issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A task that needs to be done.
issuetype.name: Task

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
One cannot allow others to create volumes from a snapshot through the commandline. A command similar to euca-modify-image-attribute would be required.
For my bootstrapper I have created euca-modify-snapshot-attribute, which I thought I'd share: https://github.com/andsens/ec2debian-build-ami/blob/master/plugins/publish-snapshot-tasks/euca-modify-snapshot-attribute
It's some simple copy&paste from your other tools, nothing fancy.

comments.body: Thanks for the patch.  I'll make sure [~gholms] takes a look at it.
Added in commit beaef04.  If you have a chance please give it a try and let me know if it works properly for you.

[~gholms], while the command is implemented it fails with a 400 error. That would be a euca issue then correct? {code} [root@h-23 ~]# euca-describe-snapshots SNAPSHOT snap-37F93F0E vol-15AD448D completed 2013-08-26T19:03:57.968Z 100% 090110401701 3 [root@h-23 ~]# euca-modify-snapshot-attribute snap-37F93F0E -c --add all --debug 2013-08-26 13:32:24,740 DEBUG ModifySnapshotAttribute parsed arguments: {'userregion': None, 'url': None, 'key_id': None, 'remove': [], 'shell_configfile': '', 'add': ['all'], 'deprecated_key_id': None, 'show_empty_fields': False, 'create_volume_permission': True, 'SnapshotId': 'snap-37F93F0E', 'secret_key': None} 2013-08-26 "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/service.py", line 234, in send_request self.handle_http_error(response) File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/euca2ools/commands/euca/__init__.py", line 204, in handle_http_error raise AWSError(response) euca2ools.exceptions.AWSError: (400, 'Bad Request', '400 Bad Request', 'Failed to bind the following fields:\ncreate_volume_permission = True\nCreateVolumePermission.Add.1.Group = all\n') {code}
Does eucalyptus even support {{ModifySnapshotAttribute}}'s current syntax (or at all)?

This is failing against AWS as well. Installed Packages Name : euca2ools Arch : noarch Version : 3.0.1 Release : 0.0.104.el6 {code} [root@h-13 ~]# euca-modify-snapshot-attribute -U http://ec2.us-west-1.amazonaws.com -I -S -c -a all Blah.  Copypaste fail.  I fixed that in commit db8ed04.

Fix Verified.

Installed Packages
Name        : euca2ools
Arch        : noarch
Version     : 3.0.1
Release     : 0.0.108.20130910gited969afd.el6

Tested against AWS.
{code}
[root@c-27 ~]# euca-modify-snapshot-attribute -U http://ec2.us-west-1.amazonaws.com -I <redacted>  -S <redacted> -c -a all snap-78409d57
createVolumePermission	snap-78409d57	ADD	Group	all
{code}
